page.title: 05SURVEYS
page.content: We questioned fifty four people in Dunstable. Twenty four were men, thirty were woman. Quite a few people did not own a car. The majority of people owned foriegn cars but a British company was in the top three. Many drivers owned fairly new cars. Most drivers have their cars serviced at a garage but a suprising number service their own cars. Most people use four star petrol. Almost every driver is disgusted with the price of petrol. Most people use their car for work, shopping and lesiure. Most people like to use their seatbelt but some break the law and dont wear it. Almost everyone thought their driving test was easy. Most people passed their driving test at the first attempt. Two thirds of the adults didn't own a bicycle. Those who did didn't use them very often.
